sentences.sContent: Steve gripped the steering wheel tightly with both hands.
sentences.sCn: 史蒂夫双手紧握方向盘。

sentences.sContent: In her hand was a tattered old photograph.
sentences.sCn: 她手中拿着的是一张破旧的老照片。

sentences.sContent: ...The cordless hand held tools we use in our homes...
...The kind of shopping－where you hand over notes and count out change in return－now happens only in the most minor of our retail encounters...
...Speakers of English have a similar gesture though the hand may not be cupped and the fingers may be held more loosely...
...read a chapter with one pen in your hand and others next to you on the desk...
...Part of your point you knew before hand but part you discovered as you wrote...
...My hand still hurts from the fall on the ice yesterday...
...and having sales representatives on hand to answer questions...

phrases.pCn: adv. 在手头；在进行中；在控制中
无法控制；脱手，告终；立即

words.tran: 便利的；手边的，就近的；容易取得的；敏捷的
无手的；笨手笨脚的；赤手空拳的

trans.tranOther: the part of your body at the end of your arm, including your fingers and thumb, that you use to hold things
